reviews.review_msg: So by the end of the course, I had entirely changed my perspective of Stuart.  His lectures seem long and confusing, but going back and looking at your notes you can see clear, unifying themes.  I was surprised at how much of the material stuck, and how much I learnt.  This class pushed me hard and I believe Stuart has made me a better student.
best class i've had in my two years at sfu.
a really good professor --- good, clear lectures with clear and organized power point, always helpful and is enthusiastic about subject.

Professor Klager always took the time out to help with my assignments and gave immediate in-depth advice on how to make them better.  His lectures were clear and organized, though very challenging sometime, but i like that since this is university and not high school, the textbook went with the lectures well but he sometimes was out of sink.
great prof and interesting class. textbook is good but not necessary since there aren't any exams. TA was also very helpful.

great prof who shows he cares about students and how well they are doing in the course, is a fair marker and his lectures are interesting and very clear. Easy to understand power point and uses lots of good videos. I didn't know much about the course subject but I learned a lot. Would definately take another course from him!

Treats a lower level course as if it is a 3rd or 4th year coarse. Uses redundent language in lectures/assignments and is very hard to understant. Rambles on about petty information in lectures and never finshes on time. If it wasnt for the TA I wouldnt understand anything he said.
Good helpful prof, easy to understand and provided assistance whenever asked for.

Taking Hist 288 with Hilmar was a pleasure. He shows knowledge and passion for the content in engaging lectures. The class is well-structured with no difficult exams, and the amount of reading is reasonable for a textbook-free course. He has a blunt sense of humor which some may interpret as being obnoxious or rude, as per reviews, but I disagree.

Terrible prof! Lost my 4.11 GPA because of him. Something wrong with the way he marks. Do NOT take a class with him if you want to keep your GPA where it's at. If you don't care, then by all means do. But prepare to spend more time on that class than you do any other class and STILL get the worst mark you've EVER gotten.

If you take one of his classes beware. For tests he asks u 2 write 3 things & gives you 3 1 inch lines then marks them wrong because u didn't explain them, when the quest never asked 4 it.Paper marks r ridiculous, write his opinion & u may survive.
Be warned--his marking scheme is vicious (i.e. unrealistic expectations from students). Don't be surprised by an "F" on one of your assignments in his classes... Shudder...

Professor O'Brien was great! Her lectures are very organized & her tutorials cover the readings in detail. She gives very detailed feedback for midterms and papers (a whole page of feedback for a paper)! She is very enthusiastic and approachable! I would take a course with her again!

Great professor who will tank your GPA if you aren't careful and thorough. She's friendly, helpful, provides you with enormously detailed feedback on your essays and exams, but the amount of detailcriticism will probably make you feel really, really dumb, no matter how nicely she puts it.

Emily is a friendly prof and seems passionate about teaching.  It's a shame that she has to be such a tough marker. The way she marked my papers seemed almost vindictive. This prof is often unclear about expectations. I was surprised to find a 2nd year history class to be so needlessly difficult.
Interesting subject. However, she fails to clairify assignment expecations properly. Essay criticism is at times contradictory.
